parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The intermittent failure of the power steering system can cause the steering wheel to become difficult to maneuver, making it hard to control the vehicle, which can lead to accidents or near-miss situations.
symptoms: The steering wheel becomes heavy or stiff
the steering wheel pulls to one side
the steering wheel does not center after turns
the vehicle is difficult to steer or control
the power steering assist is lost intermittently.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Carbon Fiber Roof Delamination and Degradation
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The delamination and degradation of the carbon fiber roof can cause water to enter the vehicle, leading to potential electrical issues, rust, and safety hazards. In extreme cases, the roof may detach from the vehicle while driving, posing a risk to the occupants and other road users.
symptoms: Bubbling or peeling of the roof
flaking off of the roof material

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The shattering of the rear hatch glass can cause damage to the vehicle and surrounding property, and may lead to safety hazards if the shattered glass causes a distraction or obstruction while driving.
symptoms: Sudden shattering of the rear hatch glass
requiring replacement of the entire hatch assembly.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Battery degradation can cause the vehicle to lose power, leading to reduced performance, decreased fuel efficiency, and potentially leaving the driver stranded.
The failure of the airbag system can increase the risk of injury or death in the event of an accident, as the airbags may not deploy properly.
The sudden loss of power steering and engine shut-off can cause loss of control, increasing the risk of accidents, and potentially leaving the driver stranded.
